question: Paul got a box of 440 crayons for his birthday. During the school year he gave 111 crayons to his friends while he lost 106 crayons. How many crayons did he have left?
response: Paul started with 440 crayons. He gave away 111 crayons to his friends, leaving him with 440 - 111 = 329 crayons. He lost 106 crayons, so he had 329 - 106 = 223 crayons left. The answer is 223.
